uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.named.operation.jcs.cache

Class NamedOperationJCSCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.named.operation.cache.AbstractNamedOperationCache
      • uk.gov.gchq.gaffer.named.operation.jcs.cache.NamedOperationJCSCache
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    INamedOperationCache

    public final class NamedOperationJCSCache
extends AbstractNamedOperationCache
    Implementation of INamedOperationCache that uses an Apache JCS Cache to store NamedOperationDetails. This cache is configured using the cache.ccf file.

    • Method Detail

      • addToCache

        public void addToCache(String name,
                       NamedOperationDetail namedOperation,
                       boolean overwrite)
                throws CacheOperationFailedException
        Adds a NamedOperationDetail to the cache. If the name or NamedOperationDetail is null then a CacheOperationFailedException will be thrown. If the function is called with the overwrite flag set to false then the operation will fail if a NamedOperationDetail already exists with the given name.
        Specified by:
        addToCache in class AbstractNamedOperationCache
        Parameters:
        name - The name/key to store the NamedOperationDetail against
        namedOperation - The NamedOperationDetail to be stored
        overwrite - Whether or not to overwrite an existing NamedOperationDetail
        Throws:
        CacheOperationFailedException - thrown if the operation fails

      • deleteFromCache

        public void deleteFromCache(String name)
                     throws CacheOperationFailedException
        Removes a key and value from the cache. If it fails then an exception is thrown
        Specified by:
        deleteFromCache in class AbstractNamedOperationCache
        Parameters:
        name - The key to delete
        Throws:
        CacheOperationFailedException - Thrown when the delete fails

      • getAllNamedOperations

        public CloseableIterable<NamedOperationDetail> getAllNamedOperations(User user)
        Gets all the keys from the cache and iterates through each NamedOperationDetail stored in the cache. Assuming the user has read permission (therefore can execute the NamedOperation) it either adds a NamedOperation or NamedOperationDetail to a set, depending on the simple flag which would ordinarily be set to true.
        Specified by:
        getAllNamedOperations in interface INamedOperationCache
        Specified by:
        getAllNamedOperations in class AbstractNamedOperationCache
        Parameters:
        user - The user making the request
        Returns:
        a set of NamedOperations

      • getFromCache

        public NamedOperationDetail getFromCache(String name)
                                  throws CacheOperationFailedException
        Checks the supplied name is not null, an Object exists with this name in the cache, that Object is not null and is an instance of NamedOperationDetail. If all these conditions are met, the NamedOperationDetail is returned, if any are not met then an exception is thrown.
        Specified by:
        getFromCache in class AbstractNamedOperationCache
        Parameters:
        name - the key stored in the cache
        Returns:
        a NamedOperationDetail stored against the key
        Throws:
        CacheOperationFailedException - thrown when the operation fails

      • clear

        public void clear()
           throws CacheOperationFailedException
        clears the cache of all keys and values
        Specified by:
        clear in interface INamedOperationCache
        Specified by:
        clear in class AbstractNamedOperationCache
        Throws:
        CacheOperationFailedException - thrown when the operation fails
